#3

Easily 3. It's my favourite game of the whole series, it's not even a contest. lol

I give 5 the unlockable after credits cutscene though. That one's gold. Pre special edition, though. I don't really like the new dialogue they put in there in the SE.

E: To explain it a bit further. 3 is very emotional for me and feels very round storywise and you can see how Dante changed a bit through the whole journey. How his motives, goals and look on things changed.

5 is somewhat hype, I give it that, but the ending in itself feels forced and rushed storywise. I'm also not a fan of Nero, so it turns me off in this regard as well.

#25

DMC3

The finale to that game had a lot more emotion to it, with Lady killing Arkham who despite all her (justified) hate towards him was still her father, and the sibling rage between Dante and Vergil.

Vergil's redemption is a little too quick I guess for DMC5. It's an entertaining final couple of missions, but it feels a shame that V was no longer part of the story. I get the technicality that he is part of Vergil but he was a good character in his own right. As for Nero him getting his DT and arm back through sheer emotion and caring for a father he never even knew he had was a bit of a stretch.

Oh, and Lady and Trish's roles in DMC5 were delegated to eye candy. If you had never played the previous games you'd think Dante talking about how badass they are was completely made up. Nico was an interesting character and hopefully if there's a future game we see more of her.
